name: CodingDojo LP3
description: Learning Platform. I contributed to the development of the learning platform for CodingDojo over a three-year period. I developed features such as notifications, payment processing, survey management, analytics, dashboards, and various scripts.

name: DTISSF
description: Information System. A flagship project of the Department of Trade and Industry aimed at improving MSME productivity and efficiency through better access to technology. SSF Project is meant to improve MSME competitiveness by providing machinery, equipment, tools, systems, accessories, and other auxiliary items, skills, and knowledge under a shared system.

name: CD CRM
description: CRM. Managing the company's interactions with current and potential students. It employs data analysis to study large amounts of information, helping businesses improve customer relationships, streamline processes, and enhance profitability.

name: CodingDojo LP2
description: Learning Platform. On CodingDojo's second learning platform, I primarily focused on payment integrations and managing Alumni Pass subscriptions using the Stripe API.

name: CD Enroll App
description: CRM. Manage the registration process for various services or programs, such as courses, events, or memberships. It streamlines the enrollment procedure by allowing users to sign up online, manage their profiles, and track their participation. Designed to improve user experience and operational efficiency by automating and simplifying the enrollment process.

name: HackerHero Beta
description: Learning Platform. The website aims to help users develop their coding abilities, enhance problem-solving skills, and prepare for technical interviews or competitive programming contests. It is particularly useful for those looking to advance their careers in software development or related fields.

name: VSCode Portfolio
description: Portfolio. A themeable and developer-centric portfolio based on the VSCode. I utilized this open-source website, refined it, and personally hosted it on my EC2 server in AWS for job search purposes.

name: The Wall
description: Assignment. As part of our annual performance review, we were required to record a continuous video demonstrating the creation of basic CRUD functionalities in a web app within two hours. This task included implementing complete validation and session-cookie management. Check the live video using the link below.

name: E-commerce
description: E-commerce. The project was completed as part of an assignment for a web development course. The task was to create a full-fledged e-commerce website using PHP. This project involved designing and implementing various features typically found in e-commerce platforms, including user authentication, product listing, shopping cart functionality, checkout process, and order management.

name: 1942 (Recreate)
description: Replication of the classic arcade game "1942". The project features the iconic top-down scrolling shooter gameplay where players control an aircraft, engaging in aerial combat with enemy planes. This project showcases my skills in JavaScript, HTML5 Canvas, and game development principles, demonstrating my ability to create engaging and interactive web-based games.

name: Pacman (Recreate)
description: In this project, I took on the challenge of reimagining the classic arcade game Pac-Man as a web-based application. The objective was to recreate the iconic gameplay, visuals, and mechanics of the original Pac-Man while leveraging modern web technologies.

name: Flappy Bird (Recreate)
description: This project is a web-based recreation of the iconic Flappy Bird game using modern web technologies. The game mimics the original gameplay where players control a bird navigating through a series of pipes by pressing the space bar to keep the bird in the air.

name: Street Fighter (Recreate)
description: This project is a web-based recreation of the classic Street Fighter game, developed using modern web technologies. The game faithfully replicates the original fighting mechanics, allowing players to select characters and engage in one-on-one combat with a computer or another player.

name: Academy Ninja Master
description: "Academy Ninja Master" is an interactive web development project that combines the power of JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and image assets to create an engaging and dynamic experience. In this project, the developer is tasked with animating a ninja character on the webpage, allowing users to control its movement using the arrow keys on their keyboard.

name: Drawing Circles
description: This project is an interactive web-based assignment where users can click anywhere on a canvas to create expanding circles. This demonstrates the ability to handle user inputs, perform real-time animations, and create interactive graphics using modern web technologies

name: Digital Clock
description: The "Digital Clock" project was completed as a prerequisite assignment for a React bootcamp. The main objective was to create a digital clock using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Additionally, we were tasked with adding features such as changing the background color of the webpage. This project served as an introduction to front-end development concepts and laid the groundwork for more complex projects using React.

name: Expanding and Popping Circles
description: This project is an interactive web-based assignment where random circles appear and expand upon page load. Each circle grows until it reaches a certain size, at which point it pops and disappears.

name: Drawing Shapes Assignment
description: This project is an interactive web-based assignment named "Drawing Shapes", where users can select a shape to draw on a canvas. Upon clicking on the canvas, the chosen shape is rendered at the click location.

name: Color Clicker Assignment
description: In this project, I developed an interactive web application called "Color Clicker" that explores the manipulation of colors and elements on a web page through user interactions. The project's objective was to create a simple yet engaging interface where clicking on different boxes would trigger specific color changes based on a set of predefined rules.

name: Disappearing Ninja
description: In this project, I developed an interactive web application called "Disappearing Ninja" that demonstrates the power of jQuery in manipulating the visibility of HTML elements on a web page. The objective was to create an engaging and visually appealing experience where users can make elements disappear with a simple click, mimicking the stealthy behavior of a ninja.

name: Hover In and Out
description: "Hover In and Out" is a web-based project that demonstrates the use of jQuery to create an interactive image-switching experience. The application features a container that displays an initial image, and when the user hovers over this container, the image seamlessly transitions to a new one.

name: Ninja to Cat
description: This is the same as "Hover In and Out", a web-based project that demonstrates the use of jQuery to create an interactive image-switching experience. Instead of hovering, the application features a container that displays an initial image, and when the user clicks this container, the image seamlessly transitions to a new one.

name: JQuery Functions
description: A web development project that explores the versatility and power of the jQuery library by implementing various essential functions and features. This project serves as a practical exercise in leveraging jQuery's capabilities to enhance web applications with dynamic behavior, event handling, and DOM manipulation.

name: Displaying Blocks
description: "Displaying Blocks" is a web development project that challenges the developer to recreate a given image using the most concise and efficient code possible. This exercise tests one's ability to think creatively, optimize code, and leverage the power of HTML and CSS to achieve visual representations with minimal lines of code.

name: Javascript Basic (Static Web Page)
description: A web development project that challenges the developer to recreate a provided image as a static web page using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This exercise tests the developer's ability to work under time constraints, attention to detail, and proficiency in manipulating the Document Object Model (DOM) using JavaScript.

name: Debugging JQuery
description: We were asked to clone the repository and correct the jQuery errors! In this project, I tackled the task of debugging and enhancing a web application that aimed to highlight HTML elements upon hovering over them. The primary objective was to ensure the proper functionality of the jQuery library in handling hover events and applying visual effects to the targeted elements.

name: Replicate Python Website
description: In this project, I took on the challenge of replicating an old version of the official Python website using HTML and CSS. The primary objective was to accurately recreate the visual design and layout of the website, closely adhering to the provided mockup or reference images.

name: Plotting Blocks
description: In this project, I took on the challenge of replicating a provided image by converting it into a static web page using HTML and CSS. The objective was to accurately recreate the visual representation of the image, including its layout, shapes, colors, and positioning, using the building blocks of web development technologies.

name: Portfolio
description: This project is part of an assignment called "Portfolio" for a web development course. The task was to convert an image of a portfolio layout into a static web page using only HTML and CSS. The purpose of the assignment was to practice fundamental web development skills, including layout structuring, styling, and positioning elements on a webpage without the use of advanced frameworks or libraries.

name: Responsive Blocks
description: The project was completed as part of an assignment for a web development course. The objective was to convert a static image of blocks into a responsive web page using only HTML and CSS. Unlike the previous assignments, this task required creating a layout that adapts seamlessly to various screen sizes and devices, providing an optimal viewing experience for users across desktops, tablets, and smartphones.

name: Responsive Portfolio
description: The project was completed as part of an assignment for a web development course. The main objective was to convert a static image of a portfolio layout into a responsive web page using only HTML and CSS. Unlike previous assignments, this task focused on creating a responsive design that adjusts seamlessly to different screen sizes and devices, providing an optimal viewing experience for users on desktops, tablets, and smartphones.

name: Simply Responsive
description: The "Simply Responsive" project was completed as part of an assignment for a web development course. The primary objective was to create simple web elements and ensure they are responsive to different screen sizes using only HTML and CSS. This assignment focused on mastering the basics of responsive web design by implementing fluid layouts, flexible units, and media queries to accommodate various viewport sizes and device types.
